news_header: Luis Rubiales was found guilty of sexual assault for kissing player Jenni Hermoso without consent.
news_original_title: Spain's ex-football boss Luis Rubiales fined for World Cup kiss
news_text: Luis Rubiales, the former head of Spain's football federation, was found guilty of sexual assault for kissing player Jenni Hermoso without her consent. He was fined €10,800 and banned from approaching or communicating with Hermoso for one year. While he was acquitted of coercion, Rubiales claimed the kiss was consensual, describing it as spontaneous affection. Hermoso testified that the kiss marred a joyful occasion, emphasizing that such actions are unacceptable in any context. The incident, witnessed by millions, sparked protests and a movement against sexism in women's football. Rubiales resigned in September 2023 amid growing pressure and investigations.
